page.title: 13The Black Isle
page.content: The south east corner of our Domesday area is the "Black Isle".The village of Conon Bridge is in this area ,but not Maryburgh.The division is made by the River Conon.The "Black Isle" is a peculiar name for this area,because it is neither black nor an island.In fact the whole area is a peninsula of very fertile land with the Cromarty Firth to the north,the Beauly Firth to the south and the Morray Firth to the east.It is an area of intensive arable farming and the Forestry Commision has large plantations of Fir and Pine trees.This timber is grown mainly for the paper making industry.The timber is felled and transport by ship from Inverness to Scandinavia where it is made into wood pulp.Tis wood pulp is brought back to this country where it is made into paper.As on Brahan Estate the main crop is Barley.
